resources.string: Drawing of a snail holding a welcome sign
Kind, responsive, enthusiastic, active, playful. Good with children and friendly to other pets.
Needs between 1500 and 1875 calories per day, depending on body weight.
Health issues include hip dysplasia, elbow dysplasia, obesity and progressive retinal atrophy.
Medium-length, double coat consisting of a dense, harsh, and close-lying outer coat with a softer undercoat
Saddle Coat, Black, Panda, Sable, White
On the average, German Shepherds needs an average of 1740 and 2100 caloric intake. While less active and older dogs may require lesser calorie count.
Health issues include Degenerative Myelopathy (DM), Epilepsy, Gastric Dilatation Volvulous (aka Torsion or Bloat) and Hip and/or Elbow Dysplasia
There are two types of coat in the breed. The rough coat is medium-length and feathered, while the smooth coat is shorter and coarser. Both are dense, weather-resistant double coats.
Black, White, Blue, Blue Merle, Lilac, Brindle, Red Merle, Chocolate, Liver, Sable Merle, Gold, Red
Tenacious, Energetic, Intelligent, Keen, Responsive, Alert

A growing Border Collie would need 1,400 calories per day since they’re more likely to be highly active. For average adults, an average of 1,000 calories should be enough for them to thrive. While less active and older dogs may require lesser calorie count.
Health issues include hip dysplasia, progressive renal atrophy, deafness, epilepsy, collie eye anomaly, neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis, and trapped neutrophil syndrome.
Male: large: 12 lbs. Female: medium: 8-12 lbs.
Active, curious cats and adapt very easily to change
The Bombay breed does not have any special dietary requirements. As with all cats, it is recommended that you provide high-quality wet food and some quality dry food as well.
Both pedigreed cats and mixed-breed cats have varying incidences of health problems that may be genetic in nature. Bombays are generally healthy, although craniofacial defect may occur.
Male: large: >5 kg. Female: large: >5 kg.
White, Blue, Black, Cream, Red, Brown, Silver, Cameo, Bluecream, Tortoiseshell, Torbie, Smoke, Shaded

The British shorthair is a very pleasant cat to have as a companion. They are easy going and placid. The British shorthair is a fiercely loyal, loving cat and will attach themselves to all family members.
Animal protein as British Shorthairs are muscular cats. Vegetable diets are largely unnecessary. Grains and dairy should be avoided.
British Shorthairs are prone to a disease called hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, which can lead to heart failure. Whilst this condition is not curable, it can be treated with lifelong medication.
Males: 10 to 15 inches, Females: 10 to 14 inches
Males: 3.6 to 6.8 kg, Females: 3.2 to 4.5 kg
Long coat which requires daily grooming.
Tabby, Himalayan, smoke, shaded, solid, silver and bi-colour
The Persian has a sweet, gentle personality and is a quiet companion.

Persian cats need a balanced diet that consists of both wet and dry foods. Wet food in the morning and evening and having a fresh bowl of dry food and clean water available at all times. Protein is also very important for your Persian cat.
Health issues include polycystic kidney disease (PKD), progressive retinal atrophy (PRA), hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), bladder stones, cystitis (bladder infections), and liver shunts
Males: 8 to 10 inches, Females: 6 to 8 inches
Short, glossy fur. Minimal grooming required.
White with black, blue, grey or chocolate markings.
Intelligent, gentle and easy to train - needs lots of social interaction.

A rabbits daily diet should consist of: At least their own body size in hay. A handful of suitable fresh greens twice a day. One tablespoon of commercial rabbit nuggets (twice daily if your rabbit weighs over 3.5kg)
Dental disease, Respiratory tract disorders, Uterine cancer, Parasites, Gastrointestinal disorders.
Males: 10 to 15 inches, Females: 10 to 14 inches
Short, glossy fur. Minimal grooming required.
Black, Blue, Fawn, Light Grey, Sandy, Steel Grey, White.
The Flemish Giant is generally a docile breed, and these giant pet rabbits make good companions and loving family pets.

A rabbits daily diet should consist of: At least their own body size in hay. A handful of suitable fresh greens twice a day. One tablespoon of commercial rabbit nuggets (twice daily if your rabbit weighs over 3.5kg)
Dental disease, Respiratory tract disorders, Uterine cancer, Parasites, Gastrointestinal disorders.
Males: 10 to 15 inches, Females: 10 to 14 inches
Short, stiff fur. Minimal grooming required.

A rabbits daily diet should consist of: At least their own body size in hay. A handful of suitable fresh greens twice a day. One tablespoon of commercial rabbit nuggets (twice daily if your rabbit weighs over 3.5kg)
Dental disease, Otitis, Respiratory tract disorders, Spinal injury, Parasites, Gastrointestinal disorders.
